item.description:
The year is 2025, and the war on crime is all but lost. The streets are filled with fear as abandoned buildings and darkened alleyways haunt the imaginations of the few innocent citizens brave enough to remain. Gunfire echoes across the cities as gang violence brings vast urban decay. The global war between the Mafia and Triad syndicates has brought civil society to its knees. The fate of the criminal world is to be decided by the force you can muster and economies you can develop in the ultimate crime war that is: INFRACTION.

Game play consists of hiring mercenaries and building developments. Each player is trying to kill the other's boss. Using mercenaries to attack, and developments to gain riches, as well as the odd trick 'o' trade, they try to dominate the board in the hope of wounding the enemy boss. The game starts with each player drawing cards and using a family bank balance as a kickstart to their criminal empire. From here you build your syndicate over the course of the game.

Heroes of Ahlmeran (HoA) is a cooperative card game where 2 - 5 players come together and build an adventuring party from unique Hero Cards and Feat Cards and then complete Quests to help the land of Ahlmeran. The game requires both team strategy and problem solving abilities.

As the players, you will build your party from a selection of 12 Heroes spanning across 6 Races. The Humans, lost among the land now, with no real home. The Dwarves, at home among the rock with their advanced technology. Elves, Cast out by their past mistake, they are no longer rulers of the land but rather 2nd class citizens. The Canin, a proud race resembling a blue wolf. The Puar, the cat people of Guuman. And then the Gnomes. No one knows magic more intimately.

From those races you will select of the 6 Classes that best suits your play style. Artificer, master of artifacts and arcane knowledge. Barbarian, nomad tribes bestowing their nature knowledge and sheer might to the people. Elemental Mage, master of the 4 elements. Priest, Master of the holy arts, both offensive and defensive. Ranger, commander of nature and all that resides within her. And Templar, defender of the people, master of arcane. Each of the classes come with bonuses and a unique 40 card deck that your character will use.

Then, you select a Location Deck to play with, a deck of 15 cards to represent where your quest takes place.

Finally, you pick a Quest Deck, the enemy or circumstance your heroes are struggling against. It could be anything from breaking a curse, thwarting a thief to facing a brutal goblin ambush!

Over the course of the game, you will play cards from your Class Deck, working together with your friends to complete whatever the Quest Deck requires for your victory.

With each Quest Deck completed and Location Deck explored, you gain the chance to accumulate more rare items, allowing you to play the game countless times with more combinations than we can count

A mythico-historical card game based on 1000 cards that weave an edutaining spell through the looking glass of time.

This is a game of history, drama and mystery made from 1000 unique Cards, each inspired by special parts of history. It may be played by 2 people, although the game is ideally played with 4-6 participants. The title evokes the oldest known Japanese poetry anthology, Ten Thousand Leaves, which transferred many oral poetry traditions to paper for the first time in the 8th Century. A Thousand Leaves is also a translation of “Chiba”, a region in Japan.

Every player is a Leader of one of the 8 Realms. The game takes place in Turns, each of which consists of 4 PHASES: Diplomatic, Military, Society and Spirit. In each Phase, each player may take one free Action (“Phase Action”). Armies may traverse the globe or Priests build Temples, units turn against their masters or debates alter the fate of nations.

The game also features a representation of ancient warfare, complete with a Center, Left and Right and real battlefield strategies. Each player takes an action through pieces (Face Cards) on an imaginary board, alternating until all pieces have taken at least one action before the next turn begins.

Sticks and Stones is a fun, strategic card game, that gives you the power to choose your path to victory.

In S&S you will:

-Battle your opponent through the use of characters, enhancements, vehicles, heroes, and creatures!

-Beef up your characters with potions, special abilities, magic, and more!

-Crush your enemy using brute force, or a more tactical approach!

S&S has:

-Unique, and crazy cool artwork!

-Custom die for tracking progress!

-High quality components made to last through years of fun!

-An easy learning curve, while also giving you the option for more in depth gameplay!

How is it played?

1. Build your deck from a large selection of cool characters, crazy enhancements, and awesome creatures. Then choose your hero for the battle!

2. Obliterate your opponent! Using your deck you will Deploy>Enhance>Attack>Discard. Use ranged and melee cards to attack. Juice them up with some spells. Place in some defensive vehicles to block incoming attacks. Use counter-attack cards to send the enemies attacks right back at them!

3. After capturing the opposing hero, regroup and rebuild your deck for the next battle. Don't forget to adjust your strategy, because now your opponent will gain an advantage through the use of terrain cards! So stay alert and think outside of the box or you might be caught blindsided by a brutal attack

In Path of Dice the goal is to create a connected path of dice from your starting area to the opposite end of the board by placing the just-rolled dice according to a few simple rules. Your opponent is of course doing the same from the other end thus creating a lot of conflict.

It's a fun, fast, simple and surprisingly strategic game for two or four players.

A 2-player game is played in about ten minutes with strategic decisions being made on most throws.

With so many dice being rolled luck does play a big part in who wins the game. But the strategic depth of the game could still surprise its creator even after 50+ played games.

Set in a steampunk universe, Heavy Steam is a game about piloting a giant mechanical humanoid war machine of doom. As a pilot you use the steam titan’s resources to strategically complete scenario objectives. More often than not it’s to defeat your opponent, but you’ve never shied away from a fight, have you?

--In Heavy Steam you play the role of a pilot controlling your steam titan’s systems from the command center inside its head.
--Fully customize your steam titan: choose a robot, recruit your pilot, then customize with weapons of your choice.
--Plan ahead if you want to power your legs, weapons or other systems.
--The battle board is abstracted with easy to master combat.
--Event cards, terrain cards and other cards keep the game fresh and new every time you play.

Play through a variety of focused scenarios or just battle it out until only the champion remains! With several game modes from which to choose, you always face another challenging battle ahead – will you take up the call?

item.description:
Juego de tablero para varios jugadores inspirado en el wrestling, en concreto en la WWE, editado y creado en España.
Cada jugador representa un luchador, y debe lograr ser el único que quede con puntos de vida sobre el ring.
Para ello usaran cartas que podrán usar para atacar o defenderse.


Inspired by wrestling, specifically WWE, edited and created in Spain.

Each player takes a fighter, an energy marker, and 50 random cards. In turn a player will take a card and roll a die to advance. When all players are in the ring, a player may start a fight against an opponent. Cards are used to attack or defend. The game ends when there is only one player with energy.

“There are only five of us now, three of us didn’t make it when we ran into them on the other side of the stream. None of us wants to think that they are following us, mindless, only wanting to feast on our flesh, but we cannot stop thinking of the horror behind us.
We are all shocked and exhausted but we must keep going. The trees are thinning out and I can see lights ahead… we’ve almost made it… A farm surrounded by bushes but with lights on, there must be other survivors there. No, not bushes – the house is surrounded by dozens of zombies, trying to break in. I can hear their moans even this far away, they sound so close.
They are among the trees. Shambling over dead wood, we are surrounded…”

7ombieTV is a standalone Zombie horror spinoff from acclaimed spy-fi miniatures game 7TV. It is the 1980s, and the dead have risen with terrifying amounts of gore and a fearsome appetite for your flesh! Only with a bold heart and a large amount of unlikely weaponry can you survive the night…

Players make their force spending points and following rules on the number of heroes and sheep they can have as there are three levels of characters. The game is won when one side completes the objective, points can be scored for other task completed during the game such as killing of zombies! Elements can be used in the 7TV games if desired.

This is a talking children's boardgame. This is a roll-and-move game with cards. The theme of the game is eating.

The object is to be the first one to get rid of all of your food cards.

Player uses a cardboard "bombsite" to drop marble bombs on "flip" targets in the box for up to 1000 points. Perfect score is 3150 points.

Unit is self contained. Lid of box is lifted off containing the flip target display. Player stands over the box dropping the black marble "bombs" using the provided "bombsite" marble tube.

Method and "bombsite" actually work very well!! "Bombsite is made like a pair of binoculars with a tube attached. When adjusted they actually display an X to site over the "target" and drop the marble from the attached tube. All made of heavy cardboard!!

Long ago, in a decade not so far away, there existed video games so legendary their legacies carry on to this very day.

16-Bit RPG: The Board Game is exactly that: a board game that pays homage to a time period in video game history gone by. A period that holds a very special place in the hearts of many!

Collect loot, gear your character, use skills, fight monsters and progress through the world until you’re ready to take on one of the mighty Final Bosses!

- Classic RPG styled pixel art
- Easy to learn loot collecting board game
- Skills and Events offer variance in each game

Gameplay

During Your Turn you roll the dice and move the spaces to see what happend; like finding loot, entering on a market or fighting a monster! You use your cards to deal with the adventures by equiping wargear or using items like potions. 
You play until one player gets to defeat the final boss.

item.description:
From the box back:

ELEPHONKEY The game where the truth has a major deficit

Everybody’s full of Elephonkey in this not-really-political party game!

Play your hand and lay down your cards, announcing their ranks… are you gonna tell the truth? Maybe… and maybe not! Donkeys, Elephants, Tree-Huggers and Tea Partiers are the “suits” and there are a couple special interest porkers mixed in.

If you think somebody’s lying about the cards they play, shout, “ELEPHONKEY!” Be first to get rid of your cards and you’ll have a landslide victory!

item.description:
Assault on Doomrock is a co-operative adventure game set in a humorous fantasy world. Players start the adventure by generating random heroes from two cards. Combinations like sadistic paladin, stinky warrior, frustrated mage or impatient rogue are only few of the possibilities.

The unique party of heroes will venture forth into a randomly assembled world map. While gaining crazy abilities, and searching for gold and ridiculous items, heroes must face three increasingly difficult encounters. These battles play out in a grid-free, highly tactical battle system that uses character positioning, dice and ability cards.

The goal of the game is to defeat the third epic boss encounter. In order to do that, heroes must carefully exploit the map to grow as powerful as possible before they run out of time.

Feature highlights:

 Fully cooperative board game, with card driven artificial intelligence.
 Variable heroes and scenarios, generated from over 300 cards.
 Grid-free, highly tactical battle system, with dice allocation planning phase.
 Fully randomized adventure on the world map, with quests, events, shops and rewarding exploration.
 6 Heroes with 8 random traits. 74 unique ability cards. 70 item rewards.
 9 possible battle encounters, each with their unique artificial intelligence deck, which gives over 30 battle encounter combinations.

Assault on Doomrock: Indiegogo Promo Pack

item.description: Players start with three stacks of five discs, each stacked by decreasing size 5-4-3-2-1. Each move involves splitting a stack to deploy each piece along a (possibly different) line of the mover's choice, to stop on the closest N+1 disc, if any, else the furthest empty cell. The game ends when a multicoloured stack of height 5 is formed, and is won by the player with the majority of discs in this stack.

item.description:
Huey Leader puts you in the cockpits of the Vietnam War’s best Close Air Support aircraft. In Huey Leader, fly search and destroy missions to attack enemy troops, fly missions to deploy US ground troops into hostile Landing Zones and then provide Close Air Support to help the troops complete their mission, and even fly resupply missions to keep US Forward Bases supplied.

Huey Leader is based on our popular Thunderbolt-Apache Leader game system. If you've played TAL, you'll be up and flying missions against the Vietcong in minutes.

The game places you in command of the pilots and aircraft of a squadron of U.S. Close Air Support (CAS) aircraft.

A major part of the game is mission planning. You decide how to arm your aircraft and which pilots are best for the mission. Pilots are rated for skill level. Deciding which pilots to fly each mission is a major consideration. Your pilots will become fatigued with every mission. If you fly a pilot too often, his skills will degrade. Your pilots also gain experience with every mission flown. This makes for some great decision-making. Should you keep flying the top pilots and further fatigue them to get the job done, or fly the new guys to prep them for the tough missions ahead?

Missions are quickly resolved using an area movement system to display tactical combat over the target. Speed and realism take top priority in this game. Terrain cards randomly generate each battlefield. The cards include mountain ranges that block lines of sight from both you and the enemy forces. If you plan it right, you get to fly nap of the earth through the canyons and come screaming over the ridgeline to rain fire down on the enemy before they can react. Beware! During each battle enemy air defenses will pop-up on the map to ruin your day, so watch were you’re flying!

You get to resolve every shot taken at you by enemy AAA, and every air to ground attack you make against the enemy targets. Each enemy tank, APC, Infantry Squad, Machinegun Nest, etc is represented by its own counter on the battlefield.

While performing each mission, you get to decide how your pilots engage the enemy Vehicles, Troops, and AAA Sites. This makes for some tough choices. Do you hit the high value targets first, or take out the enemy AAA assets first?

Your aircraft are usually able to survive more than one attack. These aircraft are rugged and made to soak-up damage. This also factors into your decision-making. How long should you loiter over the target blowing-up enemy targets before heading for home? If your aircraft is too shot-up, it may not be able to fly for days.

Huey Leader features an operation combat sheet that tracks the progress of enemy formations attempting to overrun your sector. You get to select the formation you want to engage each day and assign the air assets you think are best suited to the task.

We’ve included the cards for every pilot to progress in experience from Newbie, to Green, Average, Skilled, Veteran, and Ace!

Key Design Features: 
An all-around excellent solitaire game. 
Manage your pilots as well as your hardware to be a successful squadron commander. 
Intuitive, fast-playing game system.

Huey Leader includes the following aircraft:
UH-1 Iroquois
CH-47 Chinook
AH-1 Cobra
OH-6 Cayuse
A-1 Skyraider
AC-47 Spooky

Component List:
165 Full Color Cards
2 Full Color Counter Sheets (352 counters)
3 Full Color Counter Sheets with Terrain Hexes (18 counters)
22” x 17” Full Color Tactical Sheet
1 Full Color Air Base Sheet
1 Full Color Player Log Sheet

Scheduled Campaign List:
Westmoreland's War 1/1965
Operation Hump 10/1965
Khe Sanh 1/1968
Tet Offensive 1/1968
Easter Offensive 3/1972
And more!

Target Audience: 
This game is perfect for both expert level military gamers as well as first time gamers. The core rules are easy to grasp and very intuitive, while still giving players a wide variety of decision-making options and tactical choices.

Each mission requires only in 30 to 60 minutes.

Each campaign consists of 2 to 10 Days in which you’ll fly one or more missions each Day.

Colorinto is a deck of abstract paintings that challenges players with different games of visual skill, ranging from solitaire to speed contest or to strategy.

When put together, those paintings form a museum, in which every room has one picture on it. It can be only visited following certain rules that are hidden inside the paintings.

The goal of the game is to discover and create paths that cross the maze, sometimes discovering the longest route in less time than the opponents, other times by creating the museum itself so it follows certain conditions.

A game recommended for people with a liking to challenging games with simple rules, abstract art aesthetics or unconventional mazes.

Clique Mystique is a tile-laying card game for two players, using the Mystique Deck. The object is to own the most cards at the end of the game. Play starts from a randomly dealt 3x3 array of cards and gradually expands into a 7x7 virtual board. Players form groups of closely related cards (Cliques) or completely unrelated cards (Motley Crews), capturing opposing stacks in the process.

In Dungeon Duelers, players will take the rolls of Duelers beginning their journey to become Duel Champions, hoping to one day become members of one of the four Guilds of Glory. The game represents a vast journey across the entire world of Thexia. During the game players will capture monsters of their own which they will train. There is no limit to how powerful your monster can become! They will face several encounters like Duelers, Bandits, wild monsters, traps, and other challenges. As they travel between the regions they will discover ancient dungeons filled with rare monsters and treasure. Players will also complete quests that earn them fame which increases their chances of being chosen to be a Guild member. The game can be played competitively or semi-cooperatively if players want to team up against each other to speed the journey along.

The game is divided into basic and advanced versions. The basic version is much faster to play and simply requires removing a few components and not using some of the content such as the monsters unique abilities. The advanced version is played using all components and takes about 2 hours to play. There are also components that allow for custom character creation which allow a player to save their information to continue playing again possibly using expansions.

Ironcrux is an abstract strategy game in which 2-4 players take turns moving their colored piece, which starts from one corner, across a square grid of pieces. Each move shrinks the grid by one piece, making maneuvering increasingly more difficult. In certain situations, a few removed pieces can be returned to the grid to open up new movement options.

When a player cannot make a legal move, he is eliminated. The last player standing wins.

Ironburst is a tactical combat board game using detailed metal miniatures and modular hex-based maps. It plays quick and has simple rules with good tactical scalability. Set-up is fast and so are battles.

The goal is to complete objectives: gathering resources, building, or eliminating specific enemy troops, etc. Players gather resources located on the board to build and repair units and to buy special Event Cards.

The miniature line and the game were developed together, so the miniatures are designed to fit the game mechanisms and vice versa. More specifically, each miniature has multiple moving parts that can be removed (if they are destroyed) and rotated (to aim, to indicate that a weapon has already fired, etc.). Thus, these modular miniatures allow players to do bookkeeping and track game events directly on the battlefield instead of using paper. The moving parts are magnetic and can be swapped in and out to allow players to customize their forces.

To allow the moving parts to take the stress and friction of repeated movement, Ironburst miniatures are cast in a special zinc alloy called ZAMAK, which is not as soft as tin (and much lighter), nor as fragile as resin, while keeping a good amount of detail.

Hanau 1813 focus on the last events of 1813 Campaign in Germany. It includes a two day battle between French and their former Bavarian Allies: Napoleon against Wrede on October 30th, Marmont against Wrede on October 31st.

Hanau 1813 is the 36th battles of the Jours de Gloire series.

Napoleon, MacDonald and Marmont are at the head of the French Grande Armée. Wrede commands the Austro-Bavarian army.

The French player has to open his way back to France by clearing the Coalised army which blocks the main road to Frankfurt. The Imperial Guard fights to get out of the trap.

The game includes an A2 map, a color player aid and 216 counters and markers.
Bilingual Rules and Charts (English/French).

name.value: Risk: The Dalek Invasion of Earth

item.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Earth in the early 20th century: The planet has faced many invasions in the past, but never has mankind faced an assault like this, as multiple Dalek armies descend from the skies, seeking to destroy one another and conquer the world.

Many years ago, an ancient artifact was hidden somewhere on the planet, an artifact that will enable the Daleks to reign supreme across the universe, defeating any who stand in their way. Such an object is so valuable that even the Daleks cannot agree how best to wield it, and have split into renegade armies, each as cunning and determined as the next.

In Risk: The Dalek Invasion of Earth, you'll play as one of five different armies, either classic (black, bronze or silver) or New Dalek Paradigm (red or yellow) as you invade Earth seeking the ancient weapon. Only once all opposition has been wiped out can you begin the search. Will you be the last Dalek army left? Watch out for the TARDIS sweeping round the board to defend Earth!

As you fight for supremacy, the Doctor will do his best to stop you, bringing peace to a different territory each turn, and if your army is not victorious by his eleventh regeneration, then the battle is over and all Daleks must retreat as the Oncoming Storm saves the Earth.

With special power cards to boost your forces or destroy your opponents' plans, and special missions to defeat other invading forces, this game of Risk is an epic battle for control of the Earth...and the universe.

item.description:
In ConSTARlations, players take turns using cards to place, move, replace and remove cards in order to make specific patterns on the board (as dictated by their secret pattern card). When a player's pattern appears on the board — no matter whose stars are responsible — they score the card and pick another.

Pattern cards are worth 1, 2 or 3 points depending on whether the pattern consists of 4, 5 or 6 stars. Players can score their pattern card during their own turn, but also during everyone else's! So they must keep their eyes on the board at all times.

If either of the two Black hole cards are played, all stars on the board are removed and returned to their players.

When one of the piles of pattern cards runs out, everyone gets one last turn before players count up their scored cards to see who has won.

Simon says "roll the dice!"

One player takes the role of the master, rolls the two dice, and reads aloud the results. The other players try to obey those instructions. If anyone can't obey the instruction, doesn't obey it, or falls over while trying then they are eliminated. The last person standing becomes the master for the next game.

The two dice are a "question" die and an "action" die. The question die stipulates a condition, and the action tells you what to do if you meet that condition. So, you might roll the two dice and read out "If you are a boy, stand on one foot" or "If your first name contains an A or an I, hold your left arm out straight" or "if you are smiling, stare at either your feet or the ceiling". You have to keep obeying all prior instructions as you execute new instructions.

Some actions give players a choice, such as "put your right hand on your head or on your stomach". If such an instruction comes up again later, the players have to pick the option they aren't already doing, and do it instead.

All you need are 2 dice to play. You can either create custom dice, or use two differently colored dice and look up the results on a simple table.

item.description:
"The spread of civilization may be likened to a fire; First, a feeble spark, next a flickering flame, then a mighty blaze, ever increasing in speed and power." - Nikola Tesla

Components:
63 Civilian Cards
12 Starter Civilian Cards
20 Worker Tokens
18 Map Cards
4 Starter Map Cards
20 Player Populace Tokens
5 Neutral Populace Tokens
8 Six Sided Dice
1 Rulebook

Nation: A Mighty Spark is a worker placement strategy card game that takes place on a planet where bugs have evolved into the dominant species.

Players place worker tokens onto a modular map, made of cards, that begin hidden but are revealed as they explore. For each worker placed one of five actions is chosen: The Battle action allows players to modify populaces and civilian cards on the table. The Build action allows placement of populaces onto map cards. The Develop action allows placement of civilian cards from your hands on to the table: providing food for more workers, building materials for populaces and military might. The Draw actions allow players to draw more cards into their hand. The Explore action allows for the revealing of face down map cards.

Players continue taking turns until the civilian draw deck depletes. Victory points are counted based upon the number of civilians in play, populace control and military might.

item.description: Mezmo is a collaborative game for 3 to 11 players, ages 5 and up. In the game players take turns adding a single tile to a slowly growing game board where the other players judge whether or not the played tile fits the "Theme" of the pieces it connects to. The game focuses on the personal judgement of each of the judges, as was as the current player's ability to convince others of their artistic vision. Failure to appease the judges forces the player to take back their piece, as well as receive another random tile from the bag. The game ends when one of the players has no more pieces to play. It's a laid back, casual game that inspires alot of conversation and thought, and is best played with a creative crowd.

Game description from the publisher:

Cthulhu!!!: Hastur La Vista, Baby! thrusts you into a desperate fight against elder forces from beyond space and time. You place the stalwart private detectives and quick-thinking girl Fridays who've stumbled onto the Cult's plans, and it's your job to find and sanctify enough ritual sites to prevent the avatar's arrival. For good or ill, you're already a bit unstable from years of mythos-busting and not above using the Cults' relics yourself. You can resist the objects' siren call long enough to save the world...can't you?
 Designed for 2-6 players, Cthulhu!!!: Hastur La Vista, Baby! features an ever-changing map of downtown Kingsport, a 1920s Lovecraft Country city besieged by deranged cultists, frightening creatures from beyond the stars, and an endless supply of mythos mayhem. Players take turns placing map tiles, fighting Hastur's minions, collecting relics of power and striving to save the world from imminent destruction. Every game is different, and the strategy evolves with every new tile that hits the table.

Yahtzee Steal the Deal features a variation of the standard Yahtzee theme as instead of choosing what to roll for, each player has a card drawn from the library with a specific combination. The goal is to get the combination shown on the player's card within the number of rolls given to score points. If a player is unable to complete a card an opponent can try to steal it for half points by rolling the remaining dice and if successful will be able to attempt their own card in the same turn, but failing the steal will end the turn. When all cards are claimed, the person with the most points wins.

The game comes with five dice, twelve cards, and a rule sheet that are all stored in a small plastic case for easy transportation and storage.

name.value: Escape from Sunset Island: Zombie Apocalypse Simulator

item.description:
Start as the zombie or as one of 9 unique characters whose survival depends on finding and transporting food, water and gas items to either the marina or airport in order to escape the doomed island town.

Resource items slow your movement down (minus from die roll), while other items, such as weapons, medi-kit and the abandoned jeep, can come in handy. Some items are better left unfound (the zombie spawn).

Get caught and there is a chance you will become a zombie for the rest of the game, so use doors and fences for temporary refuge, weave cooperative and individual play, and keep your wits about you if you hope to save at least a strand of what's left of humanity.

item.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Get into a challenging battle of wits in a whole new way with this updated version of the classic Trivial Pursuit game! You still have to come up with answers on each space, but now you can win a wedge on any space - and 6 wedges still wins the game!

You can still aim for the categories you know the best, but you get to choose your own category when you land on a Wedges Wild space. Having trouble with an answer? Ask a Friend, and if they're right, you both get a wedge!

Includes 1,200 questions in 6 categories.

item.description:
Publisher Blurb:

For the first time ever, Trivial Pursuit partners with the massive multiplayer online role-playing fame: World of Warcraft. Challenge and test yourself with 600 questions of the world, dungeons, villains, loot and more. An epic adventure awaits all heroes who answer the call.

100 trivia cards with 600 questions covering six categories: Geography (Locations), Player Characters, Lore, Loot (Items), Enemies, and Encounters. Roll the die and move the number of spaces indicated to determine the category question. If the question is answered correctly, the player may take another turn. Players must answer a question correctly on a wedge space to get a scoring wedge from that category.

name.value: The Great Adventure Kids Bible Card Game Set

item.description:
The Great Adventure Kids Bible Card Game Set is a fun-filled and beautifully illustrated system designed to teach children as young as three the "big picture" of salvation history. Kids young and old and adults, too will have fun while learning the story of the Bible.

Instructions for six games are included, from the easier "Memory and "Go Fish" concepts, to the more complex "Rummy," "Crazy Eights," "Doubt It," and "Spoons." These cards are designed to help players learn the progression of the periods of Bible history by color as well as recognize key characters, events and Bible references. Perfect for home, classroom, and religious education settings.

A dice game for simulating a game of baseball. There are 4 six-sided dice included, 2 Pitcher dice (one for each team), and 2 Batter dice, both used by the player who is at bat. The Pitching player rolls their Pitcher die to determine the type of pitch, then the Batting player rolls their Batter dice to determine the outcome of the at bat. A run is scored when the Batter dice add up to 4 total bases, or when the Pitcher die comes up "Home Run." Like real baseball, a player stays at bat until they accumlate 3 outs by rolling "Strike Out" on either the Pitcher die or Batter dice.

Comes with a miniature duffel bag to store the dice.

THE GREATEST RACING GAME SYSTEM NEVER DONE.

Racing Simulator is a racing car game for 1 to 9 players.

The system of game is simple but sophisticated, cars follow each other in single tail (1 car by space), simultaneously all the players reveal 1 speed card.
From the last car we are going to look by comparing speeds and place on the track if a car can overtake, decrease or increase the gap with the car which precedes it, and so on up to the lead car.

Every player possesses potentially the same Speed cards as his opponents, but does not know what are going to make for every turn, cars forward and behind him.

Add Bonus/malus dependings on the tyres type/condition, and the Action cards played.

The game is excellent because the player finds himsef with exactly the same management problems of his tyres and his pitstops that the driver in the reality. According to the quality of tyres supplied by the manufacturer, and the course of the race, what is the best ? 1, 2, 3 or 4 pitstops (Hard or soft tyres) !!!

Cars not attributed to a player are managed by the system.

The races are governed by the real F1 rules.
Qualifications, start in grid, launched start, change of tyres (1 to 4 pitstop opportunities dependings the tyres delivered by the manufacturer), quality and wear of tyres, rain, track humidity level, incidents, accidents, penalties, safety car, everything is simulated with simple rules easy to implement.

1 party lasts approximately 1 hours 30 (40 minutes for the Family game).

Darin A. Leviloff's Hapsburg Eclipse is a solitaire States of Siege game on World War One in Eastern Europe from 1914-1918. The player controls the leadership of the Austro-Hungarian Empire and, peripherally, the German Central Staff who assumes greater and greater control over their ally. The Austro-Hungarians have unique challenges as they try to survive the onslaught of the “Russian Steamroller” and try to conquer the Serbs in the South. The mission will be complicated by the perseverance of those enemies; the difficulties with new fronts in Romania, the Balkans, and the Italian border; and the difficulty of keeping the Empire's restive nationalities from revolting from Hapsburg Rule.

The war started poorly for the Austro-Hungarians, with major Russian advances in the East and no progress against the Serbians. As time went on and the Austro-Hungarians bounced from one crisis to another, the Germans started to take more control as the price for their aid. In the end, the war was too much for the disparate nationalities of Austria-Hungary to take, and when it became clear that the Central Powers could not win the war, the Austro-Hungarian Empire disintegrated.

Can you succeed in keeping the Hapsburg Monarchy intact? Play Hapsburg Eclipse and find out!

Hapsburg Eclipse has a sister game titled Ottoman Sunset, depicting the struggle of their Central Powers ally, the Ottoman Empire. If in possession of both games, a Combined Game is playable, either as a two player co-op game or as a large two-front solitaire game. The rules for the Combined Game are included with Hapsburg Eclipse and modify the rules for each individual game.

link.value: Victory Point Games States of Siege Series

item.description:
Rivers is a tile-placement and set collection standard deck playing card game for two players. Players form distributaries off of the contested Blackjack River. Whenever a player forms a distributary with exactly 21 fish in it, they score it. Once the Blackjack River has run dry, the player with the most points wins the game!

The game can be played with either the custom Rivers: The Playing Card Game deck consisting of 70 cards or a standard playing card deck (including Jokers) along with the 4s, 5s, 6s, and 7s from a second matching standard playing card deck.

The second in a series of dice games played on an 8x8 board. It combines elements of Poker, Pente, and Yahtzee. The dice are rolled, placed, moved and rerolled. The first player to form 3 separate rows of modified poker hands on the board wins.

On the northern border of Elsemore, where the High Road becomes but a path and disappears into the nightly thicket of the Blackwood Forest stands an inn the walls of which remember a time of Heroes now long gone. And as the days grow short short and grim, as the cold shadows of the North lengthen once again, songs of great deeds are sang in the golden glow of an age-old hearth. Tales of woe and glory, of hope and despair await those who turn their ear to the Songs of Artha.

Songs of Artha is a solitaire/cooperative fantasy adventure card game that pits legendary Heroes against monsters and perils of the dark fantasy world of Artha. Introducing a deckbuilding-inspired deck management mechanism, diverse enemies and randomized adventures, Songs of Artha is a game for fans of exciting fantasy adventures, as well as for gamers who enjoy involved card play and in-game deck manipulation.

Live the story of every Hero alone – or combine Hero Core Sets to play with your friends - and write a saga the world of Artha will never forget.

name.value: To je Fotbal: Czech vs Slovakia

item.description:
To Je Fotbal (This Is Football) is a true simulation of a football match, a strategic board game that brings football action to your table by combining football rules and game strategy.

To Je Fotbal is a game for two football managers. Each team consists of the basic eleven players and five substitutes. The players are marked with a colored base corresponding to their role on the pitch. The forwards, midfielders, defenders, goalkeeper and captain all perform different functions. The basic skills can be enhanced by using special cards according to the manager's chosen strategy. During one turn, the manager can move three players in any direction according to their attributes and kick the ball if it is in possession of the team. Playing time is 2 x 45 turns (and maybe extra time).

The basic rules make it easy to get into the game for those aged 10 and up, and they cover situations such as passing, shooting, goal kick, saves, offside, posts, tacking for ball and position, extra time, substitutions and (of course) goals. The extended rules contain special situations such as corner kick, throw-in, free kicks and penalty kicks, fouls, yellow and red cards and even diving.

The game pieces are miniatures of football players in team jerseys with names, numbers and even sponsors' logos. The atmosphere of a football stadium is completed not only by a full-colored 82x55 cm game board with goals, flags and advertising panels, but also by an imitation of a scoreboard. All components (special cards, scoreboard) are in English, with the printed rules in the box coming in six languages.

The first edition, "10th Czech vs Slovakia derby", is supported by the Czech and Slovak national teams. You will find such football greats as Petr Cech, Tomas Rosicky, Marek Hamsik and Martin Skrtel in the teams.

item.description:
This is a free print and play game.

Life on Earth rides on the back of huge continents, and in the seas around them. Different species are interconnected with one another and influence the habitat for all life. In this game you introduce species (represented by playing cards) to your individual continent. Each species influences the global temperature, as well as having a preferred temperature range of its own. The individual continents have a unique special ability, playable once per game. The aim of the game is to collect the most victory points by having species on your continent survive Extinctions. This game lets you play out an alternative history of Earth, past, present and future!

C.W. Faulkner published numerous sectional card based board games around the turn of the century. Zooloo has uniquely shaped cards that form an animal themed globe.

Play starts by shuffling the smaller card deck and taking turns playing cards around the circular disc. All players start with a set number of counters. Players try to play the best card they have in hand, then take a card at random from the hand of the next player. When the smaller deck is played out the dealer shuffles and deals the larger card deck. Areas on the circular disc carry penalties or bonuses like paying a counter into the pot or taking one out. The game ends with the circle is complere and the player with the most counters left is the winner.

Flyto is another sectional card based board game published by C.W. Faulker after the success of Upidee. This time the theme is a balloon race instead of horses.

The board is created by laying out cards featuring landscape artwork. Players start with a number of counters then roll and move die cut balloons around the board. The winner is the player with the most counters when the race ends.

Honor is a board game of adventures in a fantasy world. Each participant must fight and solve the problems of this world to be the most honorable of all, with honor being the symbol of victory.

The game consists of a modular map that gives variety to each game, making it shorter or longer, easier or more difficult. With six unique characters from which to choose, each participant should try to accomplish missions or commissions that apply different regions, and each hero in turn should try to keep his home province happy, while winning the love of neighboring provinces, including those of his opponents. All players fight against beasts, gain experience, complete all kinds of missions (including combat), engage followers, and use potions to achieve the goal of the game.

Funny Farmyard is a card laying game from the turn of the century to create funny combination images of English farm animals.

The 32 card deck is shuffled and dealt equally to the players. Every card is numbered 1 to 4, the first player plays a #1 card from their hand, the second player a #2 and so on. If the next player does not have the correct number in sequence, they are skipped over until the 1-4 sequence has been played.

"The four cards are placed close together on the table as each person plays, and the result will be that some extremely funny and curiously-shaped animals will be made."

The player who plays the fourth card to complete the animal keeps the set. When all the cards have been played the player with the most sets wins.

Description from the 1892 catalog:

"A beautiful novelty. The game represents a tower with a princess appearing and disappearing at the upper casement. Also a dungeon cell, and a vine, by climbing upon which the knights endeavor to reach and rescue the princess. When the board is ready for play it is placed in an upright position, thereby giving a more realistic effect."

A simple and quick game of dice rolling set in a fictional Japanese role-playing game called Bravura Burst. The game is played with two sets of unique six-sided dice. The first set of five dice have six different role-playing attributes on them such as strength or charisma. The other set of dice represent the six different types of jobs the heroes in your party can have based on the attributes they rolled. There are also Fool dice for characters that could not get a job.

On the first four turns, players will roll the five attribute dice up to 3 times in an attempt to give one of their four heroes a job (such as rolling at least three strength to create a Barbarian, or two intelligence and two charisma to create a Summoner). Among the six available job dice there are 24 unique jobs (and one more for the unique Fool Die) to play with.

Once everyone has rolled up their individual parties of four, they have a competition against a deck of cards that represents monsters and traps in a dungeon. They do this by drawing the top card of the dungeon deck and rolling the dice representing their party up to three times against the numbers and tricks on the card. The player is trying to roll enough damage to defeat the monster and enough blocking or healing to stop as much damage as possible. Traps works slightly differently with the party trying to disarm them with either job dice that can do so, or by trying to roll various specific combinations of attribute Dice to manually disarm them. Once they make their final roll for the turn they add up the numbers and see what they scored.

The competition is score based with a very simple system. Players gain 1 point for killing monsters and disarming traps, and another point if they can end the turn having blocked or healed all the damage that monster or trap just did. If a player can both defeat a card and block or heal all the damage in the same turn they gain 3 points instead.

An adventurous flight over Germany.

Above the Clouds is an entertaining search-and-strategy game for learning geography. Each player must reach his plane some destinations which are assigned to game start. But since everything is under a blanket of clouds, you have to push the right cloud aside to find the right place. By his flight on the board, he may, under the clouds that obscure the destinations, the geographical position of towns, rivers, lakes discover and mountains of his country.

But watch the lightning!

BrainBox is a series of thematic games where players study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. Answer correctly and you keep the card. Collect the most cards after 5 or 10 minutes and you win!

Each box includes more than (50) 8.5 x 8.5 cm cardboard cards with beautiful pictures on one side and questions on the other, a 10-second sand timer and a 6- or 8-sided die. Also fabulously fun for single-players or large groups!

55 cards show all 10 provinces and 3 territories, their capitals, attractions, fauna and flora, cooking, famous citizens, nicknames, and more.

A dice game for simulating a game of football (American football or gridiron). There are 4 six-sided dice included, 2 for the Home Team and 2 for the Visiting Team (1 Offense die and 1 Defense die for each). Players take turns rolling their Offensive die against their opponent's Defense die. Points are scored by comparing the rolls against a chart.

Comes with a miniature duffel bag to store the dice.

Um enigma é lançado e você precisa prestar muita atenção nas letras que estão misturadas no tabuleiro para decifrá-lo no tempo da ampulheta. Se achar necessário, peça ajuda a Robert Langdon, que tem dicas essenciais para você. Quanto menos dicas você usar, mais pontos conseguirá marcar e, assim, montar este enigmático quebra-cabeça. São 396 palavras!

O jogo consiste em tentar descobrir, com o menor número possível de dicas, a palavra que será formada pelas letras que foram espalhadas no tabuleiro. Para cada acerto, são concedidos pontos na forma de peças de um quebra cabeça. Quem terminar o quebra cabeça primeiro será o vencedor!


A puzzle is thrown and you need to pay close attention to the letters that are mixed on the board to solve it in the time of the hourglass. If you find it necessary, get help from Robert Langdon, who has essential tips for you. The less tips you use, the more points you will score and, thus, assemble this enigmatic puzzle. There are 396 words!

The game consists in trying to find out, with the least number of hints, the word to be formed with the letters that were thrown on the board. For each right guess, points are granted as pieces of a puzzle. The first to finish the puzzle is the winner!

Superheroes are everywhere, from the comic book page to blockbuster movies and prime-time television. Now, superheroes step into the spotlight at your own table! Could one of these heroes secretly be you?

Superhero Stories is a card game where ordinary citizens become superheroes, fighting dangerous villains and embarking on adventures inspired by the greatest comic books of all time!

Each player is dealt a hero origin and super power. Different origins allow players access to sidekicks, weapons and other useful items that help the hero complete a plot line.

Successful completions of subplots assigned to each character award victory points. Once the final plot is complete, the Superhero with the most victory points wins!

Important information/hints.

Having seen a clear difference in ratings between people who have had the game displayed to them and people who have not. We have put together a little information that might help giving players a better experience with the game. 
Hopefully, this will help improving the enjoyment of the game.

The most essential part of the game is the Space Shop. It must be used or the game will become boring and you are left with a feel of just chasing one another without any tactical considerations. The Space Shop adds strategic/tactical depth to the game.

The game is about making tough decisions figuring out when it will pay off to sell cards and thus earning credits for purchases. When and where you place field equipment is of the utmost importance. Failing at placing your field equipment the right place can cost you the game. Like in chess you must carefully consider your next moves and in accordance to your plan, buy and place field equipment. Credits are not easy to come by, so be sure not to buy field equipment without having carefully planned out a strategy on how to use the field equipment. 
Do not expect to keep a favorite weapon throughout the whole game (although it is possible). At a certain point you may have to give it up

Here are a few hints:
Gravitational Enforcers are among other things used for preventing a melee-heavy agents from catching up to you.

Space Tunnels are used to travel vast distances and thus ensuring that enemy agents will not get too far away from you. Keeping them within your reach.
 Sentries are very useful to the agents as they give you more fire power. Placed correctly you can cut off fleeing agents or blow down walls that enemy agents may use as a defensive barrier trying to buy a little time. But placing sentries randomly is just a waste of credits/cards.

Melee weapons. If you are not a really experienced player, you should not only go for strength and melee weapons. As a beginner you should go for precision and intellect and later in the game , you could attempt using the melee weapons as a support weapon.

The game. 
IPA - The Agents is a tactical strategy game that takes place in a near future. You take on the roll as one of the agents of "the agency", who fight other agents in an attempt to find rare objects to his/her employer.

Among many other things the game includes 200 playing cards of which 145 are distinctly different. These cards are both used as items for in-game fights and they are also used as the currency of the game. The currency can be spend on buying equipment that is placed physically on the gameboard or for buying temporary boosts for your agent. All cards are valuable in one way or another and you must wisely choose how to use them. This gives an economic aspect to the game as the number of cards at your disposal is limited. 
 There are small roleplaying elements in the game that make sure that you cannot use an especially powerful card early in the game. This mechanic is made to reduce the agony of an unbalanced game. 
To strengthen the replay value of the game, the obstacles (walls) of the game are placed on the gameboard before the game starts. This is incorporated into the beginning of the game as a strategic element which ensures that the gameboard looks different every time you play.

There are alternative rules that among other things varies the luck factor of the game. Gamers have different needs when it comes to the luck factor. Now they have the opportunity to adjust the luck factor so it meets with their needs.

We have experimented with a new kind of artform. Every picture is a uniquely hand painted painting made by a Danish artist.

There are many tutorials on our website and we try to make tutorials on request from our fans, if we find a need for it.

The game may look complex, but most players get into the mechanics/dynamics quickly. When we attended the boardgame fair at Essen 2013, we saw that most players had understood and gotten into the mechanics after only 5-6 turns into the game.

We are in the Beta phase of a new game mode called "Vampiric Elite", which "kills" the player-elimination" part of the game. All players stay in the game until it ends, thus dealing with "Player Elimination" that some people do not like. Instead the winner is found by a unique point system that awards being a good, but somewhat aggressive, tactician. You must be able to deal the most damage possible while staying aloof of enemy attacks. The whole point system is monitored by the agents' life.
In this game mode it is possible for up to 8 players to participate.

Don't miss out on a tactical treat.

item.description: A fun matching pairs based board game for 2-6 players aged 6 & up...As you travel around the board you have to match pairs of naughty animals to get points..The person with the most points at the end is the person who kidnapped Father Christmas & gets all the toys ! (ie wins)..But watch out as other players can steal your cards which means you have less points than you thought.

Tattletale is a fast-paced microgame about the shifting allegiances of elementary school. Each player secretly represents a different faction and plots or opposes plots to get the most playground glory before the teacher has enough and shuts everything down.

During the game, successful plotting will increase the amount of Homework or Horseplay in the school. In addition to earning points for plotting or stopping a plot, each player's secret role gives them bonus points at the end of the game. They might be any of five roles, including the Teacher's Pet, who earn points for Homework, the Jock, who scores for Horseplay, or someone a little unusual like the BFF, who scores with another player.

Twice a game, the teacher comes in and players literally point fingers at each other to cast blame and reduce glory. The basic turn is structured as an iterative Prisoner's Dilemma with the extra twist that a third player opposes you and can cancel both actions if they guess cleverly.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

name.value: Campaign To Victory: 1914 In The West

item.description:
Multi-map conflict simulation covering the German initial attack on Liege and their drive into Belgium and France in WW I until the end of November 1914.

Intermediate complexity yet very playable with unique no-dice system.

Divisional-Brigade level with step-reduction. Limited intelligence and FOW, unit cohesion effects, approx. 5 miles per hex, 2 day turns, variable weather, alternative orders of battles, Special multi-player rules.

Cards for random events; but do not drive the game.

Campaign game with small and medium scenarios.

Word'em is a card game of betting, bluffing, and spelling-showdowns for ages 10 and up.

Word'em melds the “make-your-own luck” aspect of poker and the cerebral challenge of word games.

Every card features a letter and a point value. Your goal in each game is to form the highest-scoring word with the cards available to you, and win the hand.

Word'em cards can be used to play nearly every kind of poker variant with little modification.

item.description:
The Immortal Saga is a collectible competitive card game set in the distant past on ancient Earth. The gods have discovered an unbound power that they receive through human worship, and they thirst for it more than anything else in the universe. We were once used to collect raw materials for the divine sky-chariots to haul away into the heavens, we were nothing more than creatures created by the gods for slave labor… until the divining occurred.

We rebelled against the creators. Fed up with our defiance and costly ignorance, the golden ones ascended into the heavens, much to our surprise. Then, slowly at first but with increasing frequency, our children were born with gifts. We learned that the gods wanted to apologize and through freeing us from their whips and even granting our children the power of the ascended, the beings we once dreaded, were loved as fathers and mothers. We came to accept them as divine beings, for does not a father or mother disciple their children before they are allowed to make decisions that affect their lives? The gods are benevolent and we even have come to depend upon their charity.

All they ask is for our worship and the rains shall fall, the crops shall grow and we shall be at peace… or so we thought. Without worship, the gods cannot function and if one loves their god and their way of life, they will fight for it. So, our leaders, mortals and Immortals alike, have created vast armies to spread the word of our benefactors, the supreme beings that rule over us, like omniscient parents.

The characters are played by Immortals that have been gifted by their god’s, powers of immense potential and limitless possibility. For their gifts, the gods require the Immortal peoples to pontificate the benevolence of the heavenly-ones through words, actions and deeds. Some Immortals find that politics of leadership and the courts are their strong-suit but more often than not, they take to the fields of battle to vanquish the antithesis of their deities. Killing mortals and Immortals, the demi-gods of war shall know no bounds and shall be bound only by their master’s will.

Players create characters through an easy but in-depth creation process. Each character has a school where he learned to use his powers, skills that he picked up to help him during his adventures, techniques which are the moves he uses to engage his foes, equipment to deal damage and blunt attacks, and of course his deck of power. Characters move upon a semi-randomized board as they try to knock their opponents out cold.

This game recreates the journey of the Book of Exodus, wherein Moses was called upon by the Lord to lead his people from slavery under the Pharaoh of Egypt and guide them to Canaan, the Promised Land.

This game is for two players, one as Moses, the other as the Pharaoh.

Moses must safely lead his people across the Red Sea, while the Pharaoh must stop him.

This is a strategy game, the winner determined by placing road tiles strategically and effectively.

Shootout in Silver Creek is an entertaining and fast-paced dice and card game.

Take a trip back to the old days of The Wild West and try your hand at running the town of SILVER CREEK. The fight for Silver Creek ain't fer yer average cowpoke. You and your gang are not alone in eyeing the possibilities of the town. So now, the down and the dirty fight has begun in earnest, where all bets are off!

The game offers many opportunities to be a real outlaw: fighting, brawling, shooting, robbery and hanging are a small part of what your gang has to go through to claim the prize that is Silver Creek.

You are divided into two bands of outlaws, fighting each other using cards played each turn. On your turn, you can play both a single Instant Card and a single Shooting Card. The Instant Cards offer a variety of special effects, while the Shooting Cards allows you to roll the dice and see if you wound your target! Every outlaw begins the game at 10 health, and if you ever run out you're out of the game.

When there is only one gang left standing, they gain control of Silver Creek and win the game. Good luck cowboy.
